title: Strengthening Business Strategy Practical Skills: Educational Modeling Language (EML) Based on Transaction Cost Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design concepts and language teaching experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three core elements of Transactional Distance Theory (TDT)—distance, structure, and learner autonomy—to EML design.
Learners can evaluate the controllability of learning design by utilizing the five stages (analysis, design, development, implementation, evaluation) of the SDLD framework.
Learners can develop an EML prototype reflecting interaction quality metrics (responsiveness, clarity, feedback cycle).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
